properties.description:
model info: Historical DOY mean and sd.  Assumes normal distribution

Sites: bvre, fcre

Variables: Chla_ugL, Temp_C

table:columns.name: datetime
table:columns.description: ISO 8601(ISO 2019)datetime the forecast starts from (a.k.a. issue time); Only needed if more than one reference_datetime is stored in a single file. Forecast lead time is thus datetime-reference_datetime. In a hindcast the reference_datetime will be earlier than the time the hindcast was actually produced (see pubDate in Section3). Date times are allowed to be earlier than the reference_datetime if a reanalysis/reforecast is run before the start of the forecast period. This variable was called start_time before v0.5 of the EFI standard.

table:columns.name: site_id
table:columns.description: For forecasts that are not on a spatial grid, use of a site dimension that maps to a more detailed geometry (points, polygons, etc.) is allowable. In general this would be documented in the external metadata (e.g., alook-up table that provides lon and lat); however in netCDF this could be handled by the CF Discrete Sampling Geometry data model.

table:columns.name: family
table:columns.description: For ensembles: “ensemble.” Default value if unspecified for probability distributions: Name of the statistical distribution associated with the reported statistics. The “sample” distribution is synonymous with “ensemble.”For summary statistics: “summary.”If this dimension does not vary, it is permissible to specify family as avariable attribute if the file format being used supports this (e.g.,netCDF).

table:columns.name: reference_datetime
table:columns.description: datetime that the forecast is run

table:columns.name: reference_date
table:columns.description: date that the forecast is run

1.title: Database Access
1.description:
Use `arrow` for remote access to the database. This R code will return results for this model within the NEON Ecological Forecasting Aquatics theme.

### R

```{r}
# Use code below

all_results <- arrow::open_dataset(s3://anonymous@bio230121-bucket01/vera4cast/forecastsparquet/daily/variable=Chla_ugL/model_id=climatology?endpoint_override=renc.osn.xsede.org)
df <- all_results |> dplyr::collect()

```
       

You can use dplyr operations before calling `dplyr::collect()` to `summarise`, `select` columns, and/or `filter` rows prior to pulling the data into a local `data.frame`. Reducing the data that is pulled locally will speed up the data download speed and reduce your memory usage.

2.title: Database Access
2.description:
Use `arrow` for remote access to the database. This R code will return results for this model within the NEON Ecological Forecasting Aquatics theme.

### R

```{r}
# Use code below

all_results <- arrow::open_dataset(s3://anonymous@bio230121-bucket01/vera4cast/forecastsparquet/daily/variable=Temp_C/model_id=climatology?endpoint_override=renc.osn.xsede.org)
df <- all_results |> dplyr::collect()

```
       

You can use dplyr operations before calling `dplyr::collect()` to `summarise`, `select` columns, and/or `filter` rows prior to pulling the data into a local `data.frame`. Reducing the data that is pulled locally will speed up the data download speed and reduce your memory usage.
